Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Dating: 2ND INTERMEDIATE PERIOD (not after); MIDDLE KINGDOM (not before)
Name: Vase
Description: Small vase with carinated body, rounded bottom and wide mouth with a flared convex lip. The neck is decorated with a swell. The clay is fine, compact, red and has been polished. The polished red slip that covered the vessel is almost entirely gone.
